   <h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">
    Turkey
   </h1>
   <div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
    <div id="siteSub">
     From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
    </div>
    <div id="contentSub">
    </div>
    <div class="mw-jump" id="jump-to-nav">
     Jump to:
     <a href="#mw-head">
      navigation
     </a>
     ,
     <a href="#p-search">
      search
     </a>
    </div>
    <div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en">
     <div class="hatnote" role="note">
      This article is about the country. For the bird, see
      <a href="/wiki/Turkey_(bird)" title="Turkey (bird)">
       Turkey (bird)
      </a>
      . For other uses, see
      <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/Turkey_(disambiguation)" title="Turkey (disambiguation)">
       Turkey (disambiguation)
      </a>
      .
     </div>
     <div class="hatnote" role="note">
      "Türkiye" redirects here. For the newspaper, see
      <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BCrkiye_(newspaper)" title="Türkiye (newspaper)">
       Türkiye (newspaper)
      </a>
      .
     </div>

        <a href="/wiki/Partitioning_of_the_Ottoman_Empire#Republic_of_Turkey" title="Partitioning of the Ottoman Empire">
         Succession
        </a>
        <span style="font-weight:normal;">
         to the
         <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">
          Ottoman Empire
         </a>
        </span>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2">
         <a href="#cite_note-2">
          [note 1]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </th>

       <td colspan="3" style="text-align:center;line-height:11pt;">
        <b>
         Website
        </b>

         www.turkiye.gov.tr
        </a>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
     <p>
      <b>
       Turkey
      </b>
      (
      <span class="nowrap">
       <span class="noexcerpt">
        <a href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/89/En-us-Turkey.ogg" title="Listen">
         <img alt="Listen" data-file-height="11" data-file-width="11" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Speakerlink-new.svg/11px-Speakerlink-new.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Speakerlink-new.svg/17px-Speakerlink-new.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Speakerlink-new.svg/22px-Speakerlink-new.svg.png 2x" width="11"/>
        </a>
        <sup>
         <span class="IPA" style="color:#00e;font:bold 80% sans-serif;padding:0 .1em">
          <a href="/wiki/File:En-us-Turkey.ogg" title="File:En-us-Turkey.ogg">
           i
          </a>
         </span>
        </sup>
       </span>
       <span class="IPA nopopups">
        <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA_for_English" title="Help:IPA for English">
         /
         <span style="border-bottom:1px dotted">
          <span title="/ˈ/ primary stress follows">
           ˈ
          </span>
          <span title="'t' in 'tie'">
           t
          </span>
          <span title="/ɜːr/ 'ir' in 'bird'">
           ɜːr
          </span>
          <span title="'k' in 'kind'">
           k
          </span>
          <span title="/i/ 'y' in 'happy'">
           i
          </span>
         </span>
         /
        </a>
       </span>
      </span>
      ;
      <a href="/wiki/Turkish_language" title="Turkish language">
       Turkish
      </a>
      :
      <span lang="tr">
       <i>
        Türkiye
       </i>
      </span>
      <span class="IPA" title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)">
       <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA_for_Turkic_dialects" title="Help:IPA for Turkic dialects">
        [ˈtyɾcije]
       </a>
      </span>
      ), officially the
      <b>
       Republic of Turkey
      </b>
      (Turkish:
      <span class="unicode haudio">
       <span class="fn">
        <span style="white-space:nowrap">
         <a href="/wiki/File:Tur-T%C3%BCrkiye_Cumhuriyeti.ogg" title="About this sound">
          <img alt="About this sound" data-file-height="20" data-file-width="20" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" width="11"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a class="internal" href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/37/Tur-T%C3%BCrkiye_Cumhuriyeti.ogg" title="Tur-Türkiye Cumhuriyeti.ogg">
         <i>
          Türkiye Cumhuriyeti
         </i>
        </a>
       </span>
       <small class="metadata audiolinkinfo" style="cursor:help;">
        (
        <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Media_help" title="Wikipedia:Media help">
         <span style="cursor:help;">
          help
         </span>
        </a>
        ·
        <a href="/wiki/File:Tur-T%C3%BCrkiye_Cumhuriyeti.ogg" title="File:Tur-Türkiye Cumhuriyeti.ogg">
         <span style="cursor:help;">
          info
         </span>
        </a>
        )
       </small>
      </span>
      ;
      <small>
       pronounced
      </small>
      <span class="IPA" title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)">
       <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA_for_Turkic_dialects" title="Help:IPA for Turkic dialects">
        [ˈtyɾcije d͡ʒumˈhuɾijeti]
       </a>
      </span>
      ), is a
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_transcontinental_countries" title="List of transcontinental countries">
       transcontinental
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_republic" title="Parliamentary republic">
       parliamentary republic
      </a>
      in
      <a href="/wiki/Eurasia" title="Eurasia">
       Eurasia
      </a>
      , mainly on the
      <a href="/wiki/Anatolia" title="Anatolia">
       Anatolian peninsula
      </a>
      in
      <a href="/wiki/Western_Asia" title="Western Asia">
       Western Asia
      </a>
      , with a
      <a href="/wiki/East_Thrace" title="East Thrace">
       smaller portion
      </a>
      on the
      <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">
       Balkan peninsula
      </a>
      in
      <a href="/wiki/Southeast_Europe" title="Southeast Europe">
       Southeast Europe
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7">
       <a href="#cite_note-7">
        [6]
       </a>
      </sup>
      Turkey is a
      <a href="/wiki/Democracy" title="Democracy">
       democratic
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Secular_state" title="Secular state">
       secular
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Unitary_state" title="Unitary state">
       unitary
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Republic" title="Republic">
       constitutional republic
      </a>
      with a
      <a href="/wiki/Multiculturalism" title="Multiculturalism">
       diverse cultural heritage
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-cia_8-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-cia-8">
        [7]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-multicultural_9-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-multicultural-9">
        [8]
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      Turkey is bordered by eight countries:
      <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">
       Greece
      </a>
      to the west;
      <a href="/wiki/Bulgaria" title="Bulgaria">
       Bulgaria
      </a>
      to the northwest;
      <a href="/wiki/Georgia_(country)" title="Georgia (country)">
       Georgia
      </a>
      to the northeast;
      <a href="/wiki/Armenia" title="Armenia">
       Armenia
      </a>
      , the
      <a href="/wiki/Azerbaijan" title="Azerbaijan">
       Azerbaijani
      </a>
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Exclave" title="Exclave">
       exclave
      </a>
      of
      <a href="/wiki/Nakhchivan_Autonomous_Republic" title="Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic">
       Nakhchivan
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">
       Iran
      </a>
      to the east; and
      <a href="/wiki/Iraq" title="Iraq">
       Iraq
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Syria" title="Syria">
       Syria
      </a>
      to the south. The
      <a href="/wiki/Aegean_Sea" title="Aegean Sea">
       Aegean Sea
      </a>
      is to the west, the
      <a href="/wiki/Black_Sea" title="Black Sea">
       Black Sea
      </a>
      to the north, and the
      <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">
       Mediterranean Sea
      </a>
      to the south. The
      <a href="/wiki/Bosphorus" title="Bosphorus">
       Bosphorus
      </a>
      , the
      <a href="/wiki/Sea_of_Marmara" title="Sea of Marmara">
       Sea of Marmara
      </a>
      , and the
      <a href="/wiki/Dardanelles" title="Dardanelles">
       Dardanelles
      </a>
      , which together form the
      <a href="/wiki/Turkish_Straits" title="Turkish Straits">
       Turkish Straits
      </a>
      , divide
      <a href="/wiki/Thrace" title="Thrace">
       Thrace
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Anatolia" title="Anatolia">
       Anatolia
      </a>
      ; they also separate Europe and Asia.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NatlGeoAtlas_10-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-NatlGeoAtlas-10">
        [9]
       </a>
      </sup>
      Turkey's location between Europe and Asia has retained its geopolitical and strategic importance throughout history.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11">
       <a href="#cite_note-11">
        [10]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12">
       <a href="#cite_note-12">
        [11]
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      Turkey has been inhabited since the
      <a href="/wiki/Paleolithic" title="Paleolithic">
       Paleolithic
      </a>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13">
       <a href="#cite_note-13">
        [12]
       </a>
      </sup>
      by various
      <a href="/wiki/Ancient_Anatolians" title="Ancient Anatolians">
       ancient Anatolian
      </a>
      civilizations, as well as
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Assyrians" title="Assyrians">
       Assyrians
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Greeks" title="Greeks">
       Greeks
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Thracians" title="Thracians">
       Thracians
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Phrygians" title="Phrygians">
       Phrygians
      </a>
      ,
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Urartians" title="Urartians">
       Urartians
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Armenians" title="Armenians">
       Armenians
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Howard_14-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Howard-14">
        [13]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-SteadmanMcMahon2011_15-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-SteadmanMcMahon2011-15">
        [14]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MET_16-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-MET-16">
        [15]
       </a>
      </sup>
      After
      <a href="/wiki/Alexander_the_Great" title="Alexander the Great">
       Alexander the Great
      </a>
      's conquest, the area was
      <a href="/wiki/Hellenization" title="Hellenization">
       Hellenized
      </a>
      , a process which continued under the
      <a href="/wiki/Roman_Empire" title="Roman Empire">
       Roman Empire
      </a>
      and its transition into the
      <a href="/wiki/Byzantine_Empire" title="Byzantine Empire">
       Byzantine Empire
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-SteadmanMcMahon2011_15-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-SteadmanMcMahon2011-15">
        [14]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FreedmanMyers2000_17-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-FreedmanMyers2000-17">
        [16]
       </a>
      </sup>
      The
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Seljuk_Turks" title="Seljuk Turks">
       Seljuk Turks
      </a>
      began migrating into the area in the 11th century, starting the process of
      <a href="/wiki/Turkification" title="Turkification">
       Turkification
      </a>
      , which was accelerated by the Seljuk victory over the Byzantines at the
      <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Manzikert" title="Battle of Manzikert">
       Battle of Manzikert
      </a>
      in 1071.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-18">
       <a href="#cite_note-18">
        [17]
       </a>
      </sup>
      The
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sultanate_of_R%C3%BBm" title="Sultanate of Rûm">
       Seljuk Sultanate of Rûm
      </a>
      ruled Anatolia until the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mongol_conquest_of_Anatolia" title="Mongol conquest of Anatolia">
       Mongol invasion
      </a>
      in 1243, when it disintegrated into small
      <a href="/wiki/Anatolian_beyliks" title="Anatolian beyliks">
       Turkish beyliks
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-mfk.26gl_19-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-mfk.26gl-19">
        [18]
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      In the mid-14th century the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ottomans" title="Ottomans">
       Ottomans
      </a>
      started uniting Anatolia and created an empire encompassing much of
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Southeastern_Europe" title="Southeastern Europe">
       Southeastern Europe
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Western_Asia" title="Western Asia">
       Western Asia
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/North_Africa" title="North Africa">
       North Africa
      </a>
      , becoming a major power in Eurasia and Africa during the
      <a href="/wiki/Early_modern_period" title="Early modern period">
       early modern period
      </a>
      . The empire reached the peak of its power in the 16th century, especially during the reign (1520–1566) of
      <a href="/wiki/Suleiman_the_Magnificent" title="Suleiman the Magnificent">
       Suleiman the Magnificent
      </a>
      . The empire remained powerful and influential for two more centuries, until important setbacks such as the
      <a href="/wiki/Great_Turkish_War" title="Great Turkish War">
       Great Turkish War (1683–99)
      </a>
      and the
      <a href="/wiki/Russo-Turkish_War_(1768%E2%80%9374)" title="Russo-Turkish War (1768–74)">
       Russo-Turkish War (1768–74)
      </a>
      forced it to cede strategic territories in Europe, signalling the loss of its former military strength and wealth. The
      <a href="/wiki/Tanzimat" title="Tanzimat">
       Tanzimat
      </a>
      reforms of the 19th century, which aimed to modernize the Ottoman state, proved to be inadequate in most fields, and failed to stop the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dissolution_of_the_Ottoman_Empire" title="Dissolution of the Ottoman Empire">
       dissolution of the empire
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-OttoTurkVis_20-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-OttoTurkVis-20">
        [19]
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      <a href="/wiki/First_Constitutional_Era" title="First Constitutional Era">
       Suspended
      </a>
      by Sultan
      <a href="/wiki/Abdul_Hamid_II" title="Abdul Hamid II">
       Abdülhamid II
      </a>
      in 1878, the
      <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_constitution_of_1876" title="Ottoman constitution of 1876">
       Ottoman constitution
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/General_Assembly_of_the_Ottoman_Empire" title="General Assembly of the Ottoman Empire">
       parliament
      </a>
      were
      <a href="/wiki/Second_Constitutional_Era" title="Second Constitutional Era">
       restored
      </a>
      with the
      <a href="/wiki/Young_Turk_Revolution" title="Young Turk Revolution">
       Young Turk Revolution
      </a>
      on 24 July 1908. Taking advantage of the chaos,
      <a href="/wiki/Bulgaria" title="Bulgaria">
       Bulgaria
      </a>
      formally
      <a href="/wiki/Bulgarian_Declaration_of_Independence" title="Bulgarian Declaration of Independence">
       declared its independence
      </a>
      on 5 October 1908, and
      <a href="/wiki/Austria-Hungary" title="Austria-Hungary">
       Austria-Hungary
      </a>
      formally
      <a href="/wiki/Bosnian_crisis" title="Bosnian crisis">
       annexed Bosnia-Herzegovina
      </a>
      on 6 October 1908. The
      <a href="/wiki/Italo-Turkish_War" title="Italo-Turkish War">
       Italo-Turkish War
      </a>
      (1911–1912) encouraged the
      <a href="/wiki/Balkan_League" title="Balkan League">
       Balkan League
      </a>
      to declare the
      <a href="/wiki/Balkan_Wars" title="Balkan Wars">
       Balkan Wars
      </a>
      (1912–1913), which caused the Ottoman Empire to lose the majority of its remaining
      <a href="/wiki/Rumelia" title="Rumelia">
       territories in Europe
      </a>
      and triggered the largest
      <a href="/wiki/Persecution_of_Ottoman_Muslims" title="Persecution of Ottoman Muslims">
       ethnic cleansing of Turks
      </a>
      in the Balkan peninsula since the
      <a href="/wiki/Russo-Turkish_War_(1877%E2%80%9378)" title="Russo-Turkish War (1877–78)">
       Russo-Turkish War (1877–78)
      </a>
      , resulting in the
      <a href="/wiki/Muhacir" title="Muhacir">
       mass migrations of Turks to Anatolia
      </a>
      . The disappointment in these losses led to the
      <a href="/wiki/1913_Ottoman_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat" title="1913 Ottoman coup d'état">
       1913 Ottoman coup d'état
      </a>
      which effectively put the country under the control of the
      <a href="/wiki/Three_Pashas" title="Three Pashas">
       Three Pashas
      </a>
      , who
      <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_entry_into_World_War_I" title="Ottoman entry into World War I">
       decided
      </a>
      to join the
      <a href="/wiki/Central_Powers" title="Central Powers">
       Central Powers
      </a>
      of
      <a href="/wiki/World_War_I" title="World War I">
       World War I
      </a>
      (1914–1918) which were ultimately defeated by the
      <a href="/wiki/Allies_of_World_War_I" title="Allies of World War I">
       Allied Powers
      </a>
      . During the war, the Ottoman government committed
      <a href="/wiki/Ethnic_cleansing" title="Ethnic cleansing">
       ethnic cleansing
      </a>
      or
      <a href="/wiki/Genocide" title="Genocide">
       genocide
      </a>
      against its
      <a href="/wiki/Armenian_Genocide" title="Armenian Genocide">
       Armenian
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Assyrian_genocide" title="Assyrian genocide">
       Assyrian
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Greek_genocide" title="Greek genocide">
       Pontic Greek
      </a>
      citizens.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-SchallerZimmerer_21-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-SchallerZimmerer-21">
        [20]
       </a>
      </sup>
      Following the war, the conglomeration of territories and peoples that formerly comprised the Ottoman Empire was divided into
      <a href="/wiki/Partitioning_of_the_Ottoman_Empire" title="Partitioning of the Ottoman Empire">
       several new states
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22">
       <a href="#cite_note-22">
        [21]
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      The
      <a href="/wiki/Turkish_War_of_Independence" title="Turkish War of Independence">
       Turkish War of Independence
      </a>
      (1919–1922), initiated by
      <a href="/wiki/Mustafa_Kemal_Atat%C3%BCrk" title="Mustafa Kemal Atatürk">
       Mustafa Kemal Atatürk
      </a>
      and his colleagues in
      <a href="/wiki/Anatolia" title="Anatolia">
       Anatolia
      </a>
      against the occupying
      <a href="/wiki/Allies_of_World_War_I" title="Allies of World War I">
       Allies
      </a>
      , resulted in the
      <a href="/wiki/Abolition_of_the_Ottoman_sultanate" title="Abolition of the Ottoman sultanate">
       abolition of monarchy
      </a>
      in 1922 and the establishment of the modern Republic of Turkey in 1923, with Atatürk as its first president.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Britannica_23-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Britannica-23">
        [22]
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      Turkey's official language is
      <a href="/wiki/Turkish_language" title="Turkish language">
       Turkish
      </a>
      , a
      <a href="/wiki/Turkic_languages" title="Turkic languages">
       Turkic language
      </a>
      spoken
      <a href="/wiki/First_language" title="First language">
       natively
      </a>
      by 84.5% of the population.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-konda_24-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-konda-24">
        [23]
       </a>
      </sup>
      According to
      <a href="/wiki/KONDA_Research_and_Consultancy" title="KONDA Research and Consultancy">
       polls
      </a>
      , between 78.1% and 81.3% of the country's citizens identify themselves as ethnic
      <a href="/wiki/Turkish_people" title="Turkish people">
       Turks
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-konda_24-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-konda-24">
        [23]
       </a>
      </sup>
      Other ethnic groups include
      <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_Lausanne" title="Treaty of Lausanne">
       legally recognized
      </a>
      (
      <a href="/wiki/Armenians_in_Turkey" title="Armenians in Turkey">
       Armenians
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Greeks_in_Turkey" title="Greeks in Turkey">
       Greeks
      </a>
      ,
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jews_in_Turkey" title="Jews in Turkey">
       Jews
      </a>
      ) and unrecognized (
      <a href="/wiki/Kurds_in_Turkey" title="Kurds in Turkey">
       Kurds
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Circassians_in_Turkey" title="Circassians in Turkey">
       Circassians
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Arabs_in_Turkey" title="Arabs in Turkey">
       Arabs
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Turkey" title="Albanians in Turkey">
       Albanians
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Bosniaks_in_Turkey" title="Bosniaks in Turkey">
       Bosniaks
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Georgians_in_Turkey" title="Georgians in Turkey">
       Georgians
      </a>
      , etc.) minorities.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-konda_24-2">
       <a href="#cite_note-konda-24">
        [23]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Kurds" title="Kurds">
       Kurds
      </a>
      are the largest ethnic minority group, making up approximately 13.4%
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-konda_24-3">
       <a href="#cite_note-konda-24">
        [23]
       </a>
      </sup>
      to 18%
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-cia_8-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-cia-8">
        [7]
       </a>
      </sup>
      or up to 25%
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Mackey2003_25-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Mackey2003-25">
        [24]
       </a>
      </sup>
      of the population, based on polls and estimates. The vast majority of the population is nominally
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sunni_Muslim" title="Sunni Muslim">
       Sunni Muslim
      </a>
      , with
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Alevis" title="Alevis">
       Alevis
      </a>
      making up the largest religious minority.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-cia_8-2">
       <a href="#cite_note-cia-8">
        [7]
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      Turkey is a charter member of the
      <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">
       UN
      </a>
      , an early member of
      <a href="/wiki/NATO" title="NATO">
       NATO
      </a>
      , and a founding member of the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Organization_for_Economic_Co-operation_and_Development" title="Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development">
       OECD
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Organization_for_Security_and_Co-operation_in_Europe" title="Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe">
       OSCE
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation" title="Organisation of Islamic Cooperation">
       OIC
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/G20" title="G20">
       G-20
      </a>
      . After becoming
      <a href="/wiki/Member_states_of_the_Council_of_Europe" title="Member states of the Council of Europe">
       one of the first members
      </a>
      of the
      <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Europe" title="Council of Europe">
       Council of Europe
      </a>
      in 1949, Turkey became an
      <a href="/wiki/Ankara_Agreement" title="Ankara Agreement">
       associate member
      </a>
      of the
      <a href="/wiki/European_Economic_Community" title="European Economic Community">
       EEC
      </a>
      in 1963, applied for full EEC membership in 1987, joined the
      <a href="/wiki/European_Union_Customs_Union" title="European Union Customs Union">
       EU Customs Union
      </a>
      in 1995 and started
      <a href="/wiki/Accession_of_Turkey_to_the_European_Union" title="Accession of Turkey to the European Union">
       accession negotiations
      </a>
      with the
      <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">
       European Union
      </a>
      in 2005.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TR_EUChrono_26-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-TR_EUChrono-26">
        [25]
       </a>
      </sup>
      Turkey's growing economy and diplomatic initiatives have led to its recognition as a
      <a href="/wiki/Regional_power" title="Regional power">
       regional power
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-giga-hamburg.de1_27-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-giga-hamburg.de1-27">
        [26]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-dw.de1_28-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-dw.de1-28">
        [27]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ministryofforeign9_29-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-ministryofforeign9-29">
        [28]
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-isanet.org1_30-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-isanet.org1-30">
        [29]
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>

       <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-21">
        <a href="#Demographics">
         <span class="tocnumber">

         </span>
         <span class="toctext">

         </span>
        </a>
        <ul>

             </span>

         </li>

           </span>

           </span>

         </li>

           </span>
