       <li id="cite_note-7">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-7">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation book">
          Zdanowski, Jerzy (2014).
          <i>
           Middle Eastern Societies in the 20th Century
          </i>
          . Cambridge Scholars Publishing. p. 11.
          <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
           ISBN
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1443869591" title="Special:BookSources/978-1443869591">
           978-1443869591
          </a>
          .
          <q>
           The Republic of Turkey lies on two continents. Approximately 97% of it is in Asia, in the geographical regions known as Asia Minor and the Armenian Upland. The remaining 3% of Turkey is in Europe, on the Balkan Peninsula.
          </q>
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.aufirst=Jerzy&amp;rft.aulast=Zdanowski&amp;rft.btitle=Middle+Eastern+Societies+in+the+20th+Century&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.isbn=978-1443869591&amp;rft.pages=11&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+Scholars+Publishing&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">

        </span>
       </li>

       <li id="cite_note-multicultural-9">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-multicultural_9-0">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation web">
          <a class="external text" href="http://www.todayszaman.com/op-ed_what-really-matters-about-multiculturalism-in-turkey-by-rabee-al-hafidh-_303176.html" rel="nofollow">
           "What really matters about Multiculturalism in Turkey by Rabee Al-Hafidh"
          </a>

         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.atitle=What+really+matters+about+Multiculturalism+in+Turkey+by+Rabee+Al-Hafidh&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.todayszaman.com%2Fop-ed_what-really-matters-about-multiculturalism-in-turkey-by-rabee-al-hafidh-_303176.html&amp;rft.jtitle=todayszaman.com&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal">

       </li>
       <li id="cite_note-NatlGeoAtlas-10">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-NatlGeoAtlas_10-0">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation book">
          <i>
           National Geographic Atlas of the World
          </i>
          (7th ed.). Washington, D.C.:
          <a href="/wiki/National_Geographic_Society" title="National Geographic Society">
           National Geographic
          </a>
          . 1999.
          <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
           ISBN
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-7922-7528-4" title="Special:BookSources/0-7922-7528-4">
           0-7922-7528-4
          </a>
          .
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.btitle=National+Geographic+Atlas+of+the+World&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.edition=7th&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.isbn=0-7922-7528-4&amp;rft.place=Washington%2C+D.C.&amp;rft.pub=National+Geographic&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">
          <span style="display:none;">
          </span>
         </span>
         "Europe" (pp. 68–69); "Asia" (pp. 90–91): "A commonly accepted division between Asia and Europe ... is formed by the Ural Mountains, Ural River, Caspian Sea, Caucasus Mountains, and the Black Sea with its outlets, the Bosporus and Dardanelles."
        </span>
       </li>
       <li id="cite_note-11">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-11">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation web">
          <a class="external text" href="http://www.jstor.org/stable/25642612" rel="nofollow">
           "The Political and Strategic Importance of Turkey"

         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.btitle=Toplumsal+Yap%C4%B1+Ara%C5%9Ft%C4%B1rmas%C4%B1+2006&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.konda.com.tr%2Ftr%2Fraporlar%2F2006_09_KONDA_Toplumsal_Yapi.pdf&amp;rft.pub=KONDA+Research+and+Consultancy&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">

        </span>
       </li>

       <li id="cite_note-33">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-33">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation book">
          Jenkins, Romilly James Heald (1967).
          <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=3al15wpFWiMC&amp;pg=PA65" rel="nofollow">
           <i>
            De Administrando Imperio by Constantine VII Porphyrogenitus
           </i>
          </a>
          . Corpus fontium historiae Byzantinae (New, revised ed.). Washington, D.C.: Dumbarton Oaks Center for Byzantine Studies. p. 65.
          <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
           ISBN
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-88402-021-5" title="Special:BookSources/0-88402-021-5">
           0-88402-021-5
          </a>
          <span class="reference-accessdate">
           . Retrieved
           <span class="nowrap">
            28 August
           </span>
           2013
          </span>
          .
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.aufirst=Romilly+James+Heald&amp;rft.aulast=Jenkins&amp;rft.btitle=De+Administrando+Imperio+by+Constantine+VII+Porphyrogenitus&amp;rft.date=1967&amp;rft.edition=New%2C+revised&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D3al15wpFWiMC%26pg%3DPA65&amp;rft.isbn=0-88402-021-5&amp;rft.pages=65&amp;rft.place=Washington%2C+D.C.&amp;rft.pub=Dumbarton+Oaks+Center+for+Byzantine+Studies&amp;rft.series=Corpus+fontium+historiae+Byzantinae&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">
          <span style="display:none;">
          </span>
         </span>
         According to Constantine Porphyrogenitus, writing in his
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/De_Administrando_Imperio" title="De Administrando Imperio">
           De Administrando Imperio
          </a>
         </i>
         (ca. 950 AD)
         <i>
          "Patzinakia, the
          <a href="/wiki/Pechenegs" title="Pechenegs">
           Pecheneg realm
          </a>
          , stretches west as far as the
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Siret_River" title="Siret River">
           Siret River
          </a>
          (or even the
          <a href="/wiki/Carpathian_Mountains" title="Carpathian Mountains">
           Eastern Carpathian Mountains
          </a>
          ), and is four days distant from Tourkia (i.e. Hungary)."
         </i>
        </span>
       </li>
       <li id="cite_note-PrinzingSalamon1999-34">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">

          <a href="#cite_ref-PrinzingSalamon1999_34-0">

         </b>

       <li id="cite_note-36">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-36">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation web">
          <a href="/wiki/%C3%96zhan_%C3%96zt%C3%BCrk" title="Özhan Öztürk">
           Öztürk, Özhan
          </a>
          (2011).
          <a class="external text" href="http://www.karalahana.com/makaleler/kitap/pontus-antik-cagdan-gunumuze-karadeniz-etnik-siyasi-tarihi.htm" rel="nofollow">
           "Pontus: Antik Çağ'dan Günümüze Karadeniz'in Etnik ve Siyasi Tarihi"
          </a>
          . Ankara: Genesis Yayınları. p. 364.
          <q>
           ... Greek term Tourkoi first used for the Khazars in 568 AD. In addition in "De Administrando Imperio" Hungarians call Tourkoi too once known as Sabiroi ...
          </q>
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.aufirst=%C3%96zhan&amp;rft.aulast=%C3%96zt%C3%BCrk&amp;rft.btitle=Pontus%3A+Antik+%C3%87a%C4%9F%27dan+G%C3%BCn%C3%BCm%C3%BCze+Karadeniz%27in+Etnik+ve+Siyasi+Tarihi&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.karalahana.com%2Fmakaleler%2Fkitap%2Fpontus-antik-cagdan-gunumuze-karadeniz-etnik-siyasi-tarihi.htm&amp;rft.pages=364&amp;rft.place=Ankara&amp;rft.pub=Genesis+Yay%C4%B1nlar%C4%B1&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">
          <span style="display:none;">
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </li>
       <li id="cite_note-fatih.edu.tr-37">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">

         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.atitle=The+Ottoman+Empire%2C+1300%931650%2C+The+Structure+of+Power&amp;rft.aufirst=Colin&amp;rft.aulast=Imber&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fatih.edu.tr%2F~ayasar%2FHIST236%2FColin%2520_Imber.pdf&amp;rft.jtitle=fatih.edu.tr&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal">

       <li id="cite_note-38">

         <cite class="citation book">

          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-00479-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-00479-4">
           978-0-521-00479-4
          </a>
          <span class="reference-accessdate">
           . Retrieved
           <span class="nowrap">
            9 February
           </span>
           2013
          </span>
          .
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.aufirst=Richard&amp;rft.aulast=Clogg&amp;rft.btitle=A+Concise+History+of+Greece&amp;rft.date=2002-06-20&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DH5pyUIY4THYC&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-00479-4&amp;rft.pages=101&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">
          <span style="display:none;">
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </li>
       <li id="cite_note-BoweringCrone2012-86">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-BoweringCrone2012_86-0">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation book">
          Gerhard Bowering; Patricia Crone; Wadad Kadi; Devin J. Stewart; Muhammad Qasim Zaman; Mahan Mirza (28 November 2012).
          <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=JHcZlo12SGoC&amp;pg=PA49" rel="nofollow">
           <i>
            The Princeton Encyclopedia of Islamic Political Thought
           </i>
          </a>
          . Princeton University Press. p. 49.
          <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
           ISBN
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4008-3855-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4008-3855-4">
           978-1-4008-3855-4
          </a>
          <span class="reference-accessdate">
           . Retrieved
           <span class="nowrap">
            14 August
           </span>
           2013
          </span>
          .
          <q>
           Following the revolution, Mustafa Kemal became an important figure in the military ranks of the Ottoman Committee of Union and Progress (CUP) as a protégé ... Although the sultanate had already been abolished in November 1922, the republic was founded in October 1923. ... ambitious reform programme aimed at the creation of a modern, secular state and the construction of a new identity for its citizens.
          </q>
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.au=Devin+J.+Stewart&amp;rft.au=Gerhard+Bowering&amp;rft.au=Mahan+Mirza&amp;rft.au=Muhammad+Qasim+Zaman&amp;rft.au=Patricia+Crone&amp;rft.au=Wadad+Kadi&amp;rft.btitle=The+Princeton+Encyclopedia+of+Islamic+Political+Thought&amp;rft.date=2012-11-28&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DJHcZlo12SGoC%26pg%3DPA49&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4008-3855-4&amp;rft.pages=49&amp;rft.pub=Princeton+University+Press&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">

        <span class="reference-text">

         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.btitle=Pontic+Mountains+and+highlands&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.karalahana.com%2Fenglish%2Frize-travel-highlands.htm&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">

           ^
          </a>

        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation web">
          <a class="external text" href="http://www.worldbank.org.tr/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/COUNTRIES/ECAEXT/TURKEYEXTN/0,,menuPK:361738~pagePK:141132~piPK:141109~theSitePK:361712,00.html" rel="nofollow">

         </b>

       <li id="cite_note-295">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-295">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation journal">
          Içduygu, Ahmet; Toktas, Şule; Ali Soner, B. (1 February 2008). "The politics of population in a nation-building process: emigration of non-Muslims from Turkey".
          <i>
           Ethnic and Racial Studies
          </i>
          .
          <b>
           31
          </b>
          (2): 358–389.
          <a href="/wiki/Digital_object_identifier" title="Digital object identifier">
           doi
          </a>
          :
          <a class="external text" href="//dx.doi.org/10.1080%2F01419870701491937" rel="nofollow">
           10.1080/01419870701491937
          </a>
          .
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.atitle=The+politics+of+population+in+a+nation-building+process%3A+emigration+of+non-Muslims+from+Turkey&amp;rft.aufirst=Ahmet&amp;rft.aulast=I%C3%A7duygu&amp;rft.au=Toktas%2C+%C5%9Eule%3B+Ali+Soner%2C+B.&amp;rft.date=2008-02-01&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F01419870701491937&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.jtitle=Ethnic+and+Racial+Studies&amp;rft.pages=358-389&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.volume=31">
          <span style="display:none;">
          </span>
         </span>

         <cite class="citation book">
          William G. Rusch (2013).
          <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ZMgC0VsRee0C&amp;pg=PA31" rel="nofollow">

           978-0-8028-6717-9
          </a>
          .
          <q>
           Constantinople has been the seat of an archiepiscopal see since the fourth century; its ruling hierarch has had the title of"Ecumenical Patriarch" ...
          </q>
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.au=William+G.+Rusch&amp;rft.btitle=The+Witness+of+Bartholomew+I%2C+Ecumenical+Patriarch&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DZMgC0VsRee0C%26pg%3DPA31&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8028-6717-9&amp;rft.pages=31&amp;rft.pub=Wm.+B.+Eerdmans+Publishing&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">

       <li id="cite_note-FahlbuschBromiley2001-305">

          <a href="#cite_ref-FahlbuschBromiley2001_305-0">

         <cite class="citation book">

          <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=yaecVMhMWaEC&amp;pg=PA40" rel="nofollow">

          </a>
          .

           The Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople is the ranking church within the communion of ... Between the 4th and 15th centuries, the activities of the patriarchate took place within the context of an empire that not only was ...
          </q>
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.au=Erwin+Fahlbusch&amp;rft.au=Geoffrey+William+Bromiley&amp;rft.btitle=The+Encyclopedia+of+Christianity&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DyaecVMhMWaEC%26pg%3DPA40&amp;rft.isbn=978-90-04-11695-5&amp;rft.pages=40&amp;rft.pub=Wm.+B.+Eerdmans+Publishing&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">

         ^

          <sup>
           <i>
            <b>

        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation book">
          Ibrahim Kaya (2004).
          <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=0Iy7pJBRgjYC&amp;pg=PA57" rel="nofollow">

          </a>
          . Liverpool University Press. pp. 57–58.
          <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
           ISBN
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-85323-898-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-85323-898-0">
           978-0-85323-898-0
          </a>
          <span class="reference-accessdate">
           . Retrieved
           <span class="nowrap">
            12 June
           </span>
           2013
          </span>
          .
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.au=Ibrahim+Kaya&amp;rft.btitle=Social+Theory+and+Later+Modernities%3A+The+Turkish+Experience&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D0Iy7pJBRgjYC%26pg%3DPA57&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-85323-898-0&amp;rft.pages=57-58&amp;rft.pub=Liverpool+University+Press&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">

       </li>
       <li id="cite_note-327">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-327">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation web">
          <a href="/wiki/Royal_Academy_of_Arts" title="Royal Academy of Arts">
           Royal Academy of Arts
          </a>
          (2005).
          <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070218095819/http://www.turks.org.uk/index.php?pid=8" rel="nofollow">
           "Turks – A Journey of a Thousand Years: 600–1600"
          </a>
          . Royal Academy of Arts. Archived from
          <a class="external text" href="http://www.turks.org.uk/index.php?pid=8" rel="nofollow">
           the original
          </a>
          on 18 February 2007
          <span class="reference-accessdate">

         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.au=Royal+Academy+of+Arts&amp;rft.btitle=Turks+%93+A+Journey+of+a+Thousand+Years%3A+600%931600&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.turks.org.uk%2Findex.php%3Fpid%3D8&amp;rft.pub=Royal+Academy+of+Arts&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">
          <span style="display:none;">
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </li>
       <li id="cite_note-HarriOhta1999-328">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>
          <a href="#cite_ref-HarriOhta1999_328-0">
           ^
          </a>
         </b>
        </span>
        <span class="reference-text">
         <cite class="citation book">
          Antoinette Harri; Allison Ohta (1999).
          <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=1CxNAAAAYAAJ" rel="nofollow">
           <i>
            10th International Congress of Turkish Art
           </i>
          </a>
          . Fondation Max Van Berchem.
          <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">
           ISBN
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-2-05-101763-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-2-05-101763-3">
           978-2-05-101763-3
          </a>
          .
          <q>
           The first military training institutions were the Imperial Army Engineering School (Mühendishane-i Berr-i Hümâyun, 1793) and the Imperial School of Military Sciences (Mekteb-i Ulûm-ı Harbiye-i Şahane, 1834). Both schools taught painting to enable cadets to produce topographic layouts and technical drawings to illustrate landscapes ...
          </q>
         </cite>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.au=Allison+Ohta&amp;rft.au=Antoinette+Harri&amp;rft.btitle=10th+International+Congress+of+Turkish+Art&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D1CxNAAAAYAAJ&amp;rft.isbn=978-2-05-101763-3&amp;rft.pub=Fondation+Max+Van+Berchem&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">
          <span style="display:none;">
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </li>

         . Library of the European Parliament.
        </cite>
        <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey&amp;rft.aufirst=Carmen-Cristina&amp;rft.aulast=C%C3%AErlig&amp;rft.btitle=Turkey%27s+regional+power+aspirations&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.europarl.europa.eu%2FRegData%2Fbibliotheque%2Fbriefing%2F2013%2F120425%2FLDM_BRI%282013%29120425_REV1_EN.pdf&amp;rft.pub=Library+of+the+European+Parliament&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">
         <span style="display:none;">
         </span>
        </span>
       </li>
      </ul>
     </div>

                    </a>

                      </a>
                      are also members of the WTO in their own right:

                    <p>
                     <span style="text-align:left; font-size:85%">
                      <br/>
                      2.
                      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China">
                       Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China
                      </a>
                      , participates as "Hong Kong, China" and "Macao China".
                      <br/>
                      3. Officially the Republic of China, participates as "
                      <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Taipei" title="Chinese Taipei">
                       Separate Customs Territory of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu
                      </a>
                      ", and "Chinese Taipei" in short.
                     </span>
                    </p>

                 <tr>
                  <th class="navbox-group" scope="row">
                   Bodies and posts
                  </th>
                  <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                   <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
                    <ul>
                     <li>
                      <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_Assembly_of_the_Organization_for_Security_and_Co-operation_in_Europe" title="Parliamentary Assembly of the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe">
                       Parliamentary Assembly
                      </a>
                     </li>

                      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ODIHR" title="ODIHR">
